ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English regencie, from Old French régence, from Latin regentia, from regens (present participle of regere 'to rule').
SINCE: Early 15th century (for 'rule, sway'); 1610s (for 'office of a regent'); 1811 (for specific British historical period).

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The office, function, or period of government by a regent or a body of regents.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 摄政王的职位、职责或摄政时期；由摄政王或摄政委员会统治的时期。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: During the king's long illness, the country was governed under a regency.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 在国王长期患病期间，国家由摄政王统治。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A body of people acting as regents.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The regency was established to ensure stability during the young monarch's minority.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 摄政委员会的成立是为了确保年幼君主未成年期间的稳定。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: (often capitalized) The period in British history from 1811 to 1820, during which George IV served as Prince Regent; also, the artistic and architectural style characteristic of this era.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: （常大写）英国历史上的摄政时期（1811-1820年，乔治四世任摄政王）；也指该时期的艺术和建筑风格。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Many famous novels are set during the Regency era.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 许多著名小说都以摄政时期为背景。
